sub_title: Computer modeling and simulation | Digital Health | Virtual Twin | Computational Cardiology | Cardiovascular Research Institute Maastricht (CARIM)
summary:
After 9 years in academic research, I am excited to transition to industry to be an actor in the application of artificial intelligence and computer simulations in healthcare (Digital Twin technologies), as I am convinced this will have a huge impact for patient management and therapy discovery. Twitter : @aurore_lyon

- strong scientific background in engineering and computer science 
- combined with more than 8 years of experience in bridging engineering and clinical applications
- involved and reliable team player ready to take responsibility and support others
- public speaking skills: multiple conference prizes and invited talks
- communication, planning and organization skills

school.name: Lycée Saint Louis (Paris) (French classe préparatoire aux Grandes Ecoles)

awards.issuer: ESC Working Group in Cardiac Cellular Electrophysiology

awards.title: Invited talk European Society of Cardiology conference 2020
Invited talk 10th TRM Forum, Lugano - Towards the Digital Twin
Invited talk at CMR2018 - Barcelona
awards.description: I had the opportunity to present my research at the CMR2018 conference in Barcelona, joining a session about how machine learning can help clinical advances.

awards.title: Invited talk at the British Heart Foundation Centre of Research Excellence Symposium
awards.description: I had the opportunity to present my research to the BHF CRE Symposium, sharing my work with a wide community of cardiovascular researchers. I presented the identification of distinct phenotypes in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy associating with arrhythmic risk and hypertrophy distribution, and proposed possible structural and electrophysiological mechanisms explaining the ECG abnormalities found.
awards.issuer: British Heart Foundation Centre of Research Excellence Symposium

awards.title: Computing in Cardiology Conference - Young Investigator Award - 2015
awards.description: Young Investigator Award at the 2015 Computing in Cardiology Conference in Nice, France (Sept 6-9, 2015) for my work on "Morphological QRS-based biomarkers for classification and clustering of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy patients" CinC provides a forum for scientists and professionals from the fields of medicine, physics, engineering and computer science to discuss their current research in topics pertaining to computing in clinical cardiology and cardiovascular physiology.

awards.title: BHF Symposium, Best Poster Award, Honorary mention
awards.issuer: British Heart Foundation Centre of Research Excellence Symposium

projects.title: Software for learning the French Sign Language
projects.description:
• A six-month academic project in collaboration with professors of Télécom ParisTech

• Anaylsed the needs of the target users then programmed a Kinect to recognize the hand movements 

• Implemented an image processing algorithm with a team of 6 students of Télécom ParisTech

profile_positions.description:
• coordination and organization of public events (speaker series, moderating discussions, career fair) 
• society and community engagement 
The MYA is a group of young researchers, promoting young researchers' opinions and ideas to try and make our university a better place for everyone.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Maastricht Young Academy

profile_positions.description:
• Driver of successful, independent research line in cardiovascular Digital Twin technologies
• Strengthened collaboration between UMC Utrecht and Maastricht University (physiology, cardiology)
• Leadership: co-promotor of 1 PhD candidate, 3 MSc students, Basic Supervision Qualification diploma
• Public speaking: 7 international presentations (3 invited talks)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:

• Successful persuasion and public speaking: awarded 3 grants, 1 prize, 2 international presentations
